abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education Sector
            Development Project in Burundi were as follows: overall
            outcome of the project was rated satisfactory; and the
            performance of the Bank and the Borrower were also rated
            satisfactory. Some of the lessons learned from the project
            are: 1) conditions of disbursement for sectoral policy
            achievement should be used only when a case can be made that
            the policy change is a necessary prerequisite for the
            justification or successful use of the investment which is
            being made conditional; 2) conditionality should be
            structured to ensure that there is an incentive for the
            beneficiary to meet the conditions; 3) conditions should be
            as unambiguous as possible and clearly understood by all
            parties. In cases where generally phrased conditionality is
            deemed more appropriate than very specific conditionality,
            it should include criteria for what constitutes satisfactory
            performance. Monitoring tables with indicators can be
            useful, but should not be contractual; and 4) the timing of
            the review of conditionality should coincide with key points
            in the school-year or budget-year, so that the Government
            has the opportunity to take necessary action without holding
            up the investment which is dependent upon meeting the conditionality.
